I have a question for you: do you want to go to Heaven?

Here's another: WILL you get there?
Let me tell you 1. Whether you will go there and 2. If you find you're not on your way there, I'll tell you how to get there.

Only two kinds of people get to Heaven: perfect people, and forgiven sinners.

What is perfect? Well, not stealing regardless of how insignificant it may seem, not saying a single evil word against anyone - not to mention God sees our thought life. And like a judge in court, a penalty has to be paid when evil is done and laws are broken (e.g. if a murderer was let off in court there would be uproar so how much more God)?

In short - we arent perfect, at all. And rather than Heaven, God, if giving us justice, will have to make us pay for our crimes by death and eternal damnation in an everlasting fire and torment. THAT’s how much God hates sin.

BUT:
There is a way that we can be saved. AND completely forgiven. Jesus - the Son of God - came down to live a perfect life without sin, conquering all evil and the devil's sinful, lustful traps that so easily ensnare us. Jesus overcame all of that, and was then sentenced to death on a cross.

While on the cross, God poured out the anger and wrath of sin on His Son - Jesus took OUR fine of damnation in our place. That’s how much He loves us. Unbearable pain and being separated from God. EVERY single evil thought, word or deed that doesnt line up with God' perfection, every sin you ever have/will commit knowingly or unknowingly, Jesus took the complete, undiluted wrath for.

And, like a fine in court, Jesus paying for it means that we can go free. Not just free, but we can experience God's love and be completely forgiven and saved from Hell as all punishment was carried on the cross and crucified there for all who believe. Instead, we can live immortally and eternally in Heaven.

After His death, Jesus rose again on the third day, demonstrating His sovereignty and power and victory over not just the sins of this life, but DEATH.

GOD HAS VICTORY OVER DEATH.

Soon Jesus will return and those who died believing in Him will RISE from their graves and go to Heaven, and those who rejected His salvation, message and teachings will suffer Hell to pay their deserved fines for all eternity without a second chance.

This is your chance now.

He wants you to repent (turn away from your sin and pursue God's perfect intent for your life, striving in the opposite direction).

It’s not only about escaping damnation, it’s entering God’s healing as well. God has a plan for your life, a plan that involves you being recreated into His perfect moral image AGAIN as we were before the sin in the garden. He loves you and wants to cleanse you - He will give you the strength. Now we can walk in His strength, experiencing His love, being taught what it means to be part of His family and too be given victory over sin and death.

He wants you to have faith in Him, letting Him take the wheel of your life (dont forget, when you're doing God's will you're following perfect love - following Him you can be certain that you are never doing the wrong thing- imagine how cleansing that feels).

What if I still sin when Ive accepted Christ's death and resurrection on my behalf?

Thats why Christ died. For your SIN. When God looks at you, striving towards Him or even falling, He sees the righteous life of Christ covering you you in place of your current, sinful reality. For those who strive to turn from sin, regardless of the pitfalls, God sees Jesus's life in place of your inability, and His blood so that yours will never have to be shed for your sin.

Religion = rules to be saved

The gospel = Christ saved us already we just have to believe it by faith alone in Christ alone. If you lack faith (as I did before), pray. He will make it strong in time. Trust Him as you would trust those close to you. He created you and knows you inside out.

Sound opposite? Thanks to our natural sinful nature, it likely does, but God knows our weakness and struggles and pitfalls with sin. THAT'S why He wrestled (and won against) every temptation YOU ever faced. Just pray to God, tell Him you are struggling and are unsure - God can and will work with even the slightest desire within you to follow Him and be free from sin.
Ask Him to make you willing - if you are willing to be made willing, pray for it, simply shut your eyes and talk to Him.

When Satan knows people have left His camp, He won’t take it lying down, He often tries harder with more trials and temptations. But Satan cannot do anything beyond what God permits, He will only allow things that will strengthen you or bring you closer to Him if you cling to Him and trust in the promises of His word.

Where do I start to learn about God's plan and His promises to me? Well, these Bible relate directly to Christ's life and our redemption, check out Matthew (or Luke if you want a more detailed account). Do it in stages and try and imagine the events and miracles as they really happened - the Bible is a true account after all.

And when and note it says WHEN, you struggle and fall on this lifelong process, know you can pray for forgiveness, dust yourself off again and get up because Jesus already bore our guilt and shame. remember that Jesus is the ultimate foundation, the reason we are given Heaven in the first place.

If you lack faith (as i did for a long time) pray. He desires to give strength and faith to His children in time when they ask Him.

If you want to let Jesus into your life, even to help you to take the first step, then read through this prayer here to get the gist of it and then just say it - trust God and give it all to Him because He has the - perfect - master plan. If you take a step - just a step - towards Him, He will take a step towards you.

NOTE: YOU ARE NEVER TOO SINFUL THAT GOD CANNOT BRING YOU BACK HOME.

Dear God, I know that I am a sinner and there is nothing that I can do to save myself. I confess my complete helplessness to forgive my own sin or to work my way to heaven.
At this moment I trust Christ alone as the One who bore my sin when He died on the cross. I believe that He did all that will ever be necessary for me to stand in your holy presence. I thank you that Christ was raised from the dead as a guarantee of my own resurrection.
As best as I can, I now transfer my trust to Him.
I am grateful that He has promised to receive me despite my many sins and failures. Father, I take you at your word.
I thank you that I can face anything now that you are my Savior.
Thank you for the assurance that you will walk with me through the deep valley. Thank you for hearing this prayer.
In Jesus’ Name,

Imagine how cataclysmic an event would be when a bulldozer comes to harvest some wood. The ants are there in that drama and suddenly the whole tree comes down. Some survivors travel hundreds of metres to find a new, suitable tree and they tell tales of the lost kingdom and sing songs of it. "The Behemoth," and "the Great Fright" some ants call that thing that destroyed their lost land. The ancients couldn't make much sense of it, but some of the younger thought it was a god-like entity and develop rituals to prevent its return. After a few years it becomes a religion and its origins became lost in memory as they didn't develop a written system and depend on an oral tradition. Soon the original kingdom only survives in nursery rhymes and proverbs, and few ants understand what's the real meaning of it.

I had been following a colony of weaver Ants for many years. And I must say I hv  never seen any other Ants Species killing so many varied species of other Ants. I hv watched these Ants kill almost all other ant. Their acid spray, ability to grip strongly  on the surface with their legs and their deadly stretching of the captured victim enable them to take down any ants. Their only weakness is their soft body which make them vulnerable to the bites of other Ants and also to the chemical attack by other Ants. And in my case, the weaver Ants I had been following were completed replaced by the Yellow Crazy Ants. It surprised me as I could not believe that Yellow Crazy ant could stand against these larger sized aggressive ants, that is until I saw the Yellow Crazy Ants attack the Weaver ants who were carrying dead Camponotus major towards their nest. The yellow crazy ants not only snatched away the kill of the Weaver ants but also killed a few weaver Ants and carried them home to eat them later on.

Imagine how cataclysmic an event would be when a bulldozer comes to harvest some wood. The ants are there in that drama and suddenly the whole tree comes down. Some survivors travel hundreds of metres to find a new, suitable tree and they tell tales of the lost kingdom and sing songs of it. "The Behemoth," and "the Great Fright" some ants call that thing that destroyed their lost land. The ancients couldn't make much sense of it, but some of the younger thought it was a god-like entity and develop rituals to prevent its return. After a few years it becomes a religion and its origins became lost in memory as they didn't develop a written system and depend on an oral tradition. Soon the original kingdom only survives in nursery rhymes and proverbs, and few ants understand what's the real meaning of it.

Ever since I was a kid, I always wanted to make a video game called The Rules ofNature: Insect Warfare. The game would have different game modes where every player plays as an insect in a shooter style game. This would be the main gamemode, with red ants having red leaf bases and outposts, and green ants having green leaf bases and outposts. It would play like Battlefield but the maps would be in trees. The ants would mainly melee but you could also spit acid.

Another game mode would be bees vs wasps. I would try to keep the game as realistic as possible, but obviously I'd have to take some liberties to make the game more fun and playable. And don't worry, there wouldn't be any spiders.

Imagine the attacking team has to take over outposts (slowly capturing them when there are no enemy ants in the area). Once all outposts are captured, they can attack the main base where one player can become the Queen who has special abilites and more health. Destroying larvae would reduce the enemy team's reinforcements (like Battlefront 2017) and you win by either killing the queen, destroying the enemy base, or wiping out every enemy ant. 100 vs 100.

When you first start the game, the very first thing you saw would be an option; PG Mode, or True Nature Mode.

PG Mode would make the game more PG.

True Nature Mode would allow blood, dismemberment, and brutal takedowns and death animations.

That's it, now I need a fantasy series with sapient large Ant city-states with Enatic succession that fight with each other and communicate with the human and elven races in writing only! (they'd use pheromones amongst themselves) The ants in question would be at least cat-sized so as to be able to fight human armies and hold their territory, and perhaps they would have mega cities in a magical forest with trees hundreds of meters tall and be often in conflict with local wood elven tribes that no longer have enough game to hunt because of the ever-expanding city states.

I can even imagine the main character as a prospective young queen-ant narrowly escaping the Palace after a coup by one of her sisters, fleeing with just a few loyal servants outside of the forest-City, and then embarking on a long journey to reclaim her throne that would take her through the territory of hostile Wood-elves, dwarven mountain cities and human kingdoms and/or empires. The main character would be an ant raised in a collectivist gynarchic culture, so even though she, as a royal of her nation, would be well-educated in history, politics and foreign cultures and customs, her interactions with human societies and her alien perspectives and thought-monologues could be amazing to write, especially if she were to make close friends and gather a party of humanoid allies eventually.

It's just an idea that struck me when kurzgesagt made the comparison with high elves, but as an anthropology major I really find the idea of human and ant societies interacting directly and having a shared history (riddled with wars, fear and negative stereotypes) fascinating! Hell, I'd probably try and write this as my first novel if enough people are interested!

The members of the same species, fighting for dominance between one another. But why? Each ant is nearly identical. In fact, by their simplistic caste biology they might as well be identical. Fighting amongst themselves in societies has become a biological imperative to determine the strongest of the species from a macroscopic view. I fear humanity is doomed to the same fate.

It only takes a glance at the humble social insect to see the same hard wiring that was passed down from common ancestor to common ancestor. We are truly a doomed species and yet still we press on. I wonder if celestial neighbors watch our development tentatively. Anxious.

For anyone else that was curious about the same thing I was: an Asian weaver ant major averages about 80mg in weight, and a human averages about 62kg. This makes a human roughly 775,000 times heavier than a weaver ant. I'm assuming that's at least a reasonably close approximation for the scale of volume between humans and weaver ants too. Scaling the 1600m^2 colony mentioned at 1:41 up by this factor gives us 1240km^2, which is close to the size of the Faroe Islands.

Apparently these colonies can reach populations of over half a million though, so that's the population density of Belgium or India

This video is a visual delight. Kudos to the animators! 1:30 reminded me of the Kardashev scale. Just like how humans aspire to conquer other planets and eventually other star systems, those ants didn't stop with one tree. Their expansionist nature made them bridge trees using branches and leaves. Their territory spans over one thousand square meters.

And war, being the fundamental part to this expansionist nature, is inevitable most of the time. This really makes one think, are we a little bit too optimistic about the nature of a possible interaction with aliens? Stephen Hawking's stance against METI (Active SETI) attempt is the most reasonable one on this subject imo.

Hope aliens are not as savage as the insects on this planet. The slo-mo dismemberment on 6:06 is still giving me the chills.

"It first gathers an army of a few thousand majors"
1. Not a single Oecophylla species has majors. Majors aren't just slightly bigger workers, they are morphologically and behaviorally distinct. Although Oecophylla are polymorphic, they only have one caste of workers and they all do the same things.
2. No ant species on Earth just gathers thousands of purely majors to send them out to go do something. That makes absolutely zero sense.

ARE YOU 100% SURE THAT IF YOU DIED TODAY THAT YOU WOULD GO TO HEAVEN? (CLICK 'READ MORE')

There are some things that you should know:

1. Realize that you are a sinner and in need of a Savior:

Ro 3:23 "For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;"

Ro 3:10 "As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:"

It all began when the first humans, Adam and Eve were created and God put them in the garden of Eden. God created them perfect to live in fellowship with Him. There was no death or sorrow. God told them not to eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. They disobeyed God and as a result, sin entered into the world. The pain, which this world sees, is the result of sin.

2. Because of our sins, we die both spiritually and physically, but God sent His Son to die so that you can have a chance not to have to go to hell by accepting what He did on the cross:

Ro 6:23 "For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord."

Ro 5:8 "But God demonstrates His own love toward us, in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us."

Every person who has ever lived is a sinner and is not righteous because we do bad things. A sin is a crime against God, just as if you steal something at the store, it is punishable by going to jail. It's the same thing with sin. Lying, stealing, sex before marriage, pride, hatred, ect. are all sins. Hell is a prison for those who commit crimes against God. That’s because you must be perfect in order to get to heaven. No matter how well you live your life from then on, you have already sinned, which will be punished if you are not pardoned. If you commit a crime, and then live as a good citizen you still will go to jail for the crime you committed. Right? Just as the President can pardon a crime so you won't go to jail, Jesus can pardon your sins so that you do not go to hell, and can go to heaven when you die. You won’t have to pay for your own sins because Jesus already did that for you. But if you reject the pardon that He offers, you will have to pay for your own sins by going to hell.

3. If you will confess Jesus Christ as Your Lord, place your Faith in Him and Believe in your heart that He died, shed His blood and rose again as a sacrifice for your sins, you will be saved (from hell).

Heb 11:6 But without faith it is impossible to please Him, for he who comes to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of those who diligently seek Him.

Heb 9:22 And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.

You cannot get to heaven by being a good person, going to church, baptism or any other way other than by turning to Jesus, believing in your heart that He died on the cross and rose from the dead for your sins and placing your Faith in Him. While these are good things to do, some people believe that they will get to heaven, but your Faith must be in Christ and His sacrifice alone and nothing else, giving your life to Him.

Eph 2:8,9 For by grace you have been saved through faith, and that not of yourselves; it is the gift of God, not of works, lest anyone should boast.

Ro 10:9,10;13 "that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved..For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved."

4. You must submit your life to Jesus Christ and His will in Faith, believing in your heart that He died and rose again shedding His blood to pay for your sins as a sacrifice to God. If you want to accept Jesus free gift of salvation, or if you have any doubts about whether or not you are going to heaven, HUMBLY PRAY THIS PRAYER TO GOD FROM YOUR HEART IN FAITH:

”Dear Lord Jesus I believe that You are the Lord and believe in my heart that You died on the Cross and Rose from the dead, shedding your blood as a Sacrifice for my sins. I repent and turn to You as the only way of salvation, I submit my life to you, placing my Faith and Trust in You as Lord of my life, Please save me and I thank You for it, in Jesus holy name, Amen.”

If you have placed your faith in Jesus Christ and meant it with all of your heart, you are now a child of God and will go to heaven. Now that you are on your way to heaven, you should attend a bible believing church and follow in baptism..

RE: the ants tendency to be ever expanding and war like "because empires never ever have enough" etc. I think that's actually humans projecting our bad habits. Weaver ants have actually been observed to limit their reproduction rates based on the amount of available living plants in their area. Just check out AntsCanada 's video on it! I don't think it's a stretch considering all their other means of communicating complex info over thousands of ants that they are able to communicate amount of viable plants or leaves that scouts are able to find in a general way and even get this info back to the queen who controls rate of production, or just by bumping into foragers and having foragers stop when they get that signal from scouts who indirectly control the rate by controlling how much food available to all (incl queen).

Kurzgesagt, I love you with all my heart!!!

The amount of love and effort put into every video is touching. Each video is an open love letter to the act of learning.

The attention to details that could easily be missed or neglected is mind-blowing and I notice it. Each individual animated ant doing their own thing, the changing focal point of the virtual camera, the sun's rays scattering between the branches and leaves. the music, the pacing of the storytelling.

I can tell that you all love what you do and it's so sweet. You inject creativity and love into every single component of the video and it pays off.

I love you guys and gals with all my heart. I really mean it. Thank you for making me love learning. The curiosity you spark and fuel in me is something that will benefit me for the rest of my life. You are so influential in the best way possible. You've forever changed the quality of my life for the better. I'm so grateful for all of you.

You teach people something very important... How to learn.

I'll always support you.❤❤❤

One thing I would like to say about this... From my understanding, and I'm not an entomologist or evolutionary biologist, so I'm going on the memory of what other entomologists and evolutionary biologists have said...

Ant queens are more tools of the colony than the colonies are tools of them. They don't really direct anything. Ants are far more genetically related to each other than they are to the queen, so they keep the queen alive to produce more relations, not out of fealty. We're imposing a certain view of the way their hierarchy works based on our own social structures.

Which is one of the reasons the ant's social structure works for them. No individual ant has an incentive to game the system because they ultimately lose out if they make the colony less fit because their genetic line will be ended.

Otherwise, this is fascinating, and really well researched, as always.

It is the 21st century. For more than a decade the queen of the weaver ants has sat immobile in her chambers within her nest. She is the master of her children by the merit of luck and and the master of thousand trees by the might of her inexhaustible armies. She is a swollen creature, writing with the growth of a hundred eggs at a time. She is the lord of her colony, for whom a thousand insects are sacrificed every day, so that she will never die of starvation.
Yet even in her stagnant state, the queen of the weaver ants continues her endless vigil. Countless ants cross the life-infested mess of the canopy, guided only by their own chemical secretions. Vast armies give battle in her name on uncounted plants. Greatest amongst them are the super majors, unusually large ants whose roles are the most hazardous. Their allies are legion, but even for their multitudes they are barely enough to hold off the ever-present threat from pests, predators, rival ant kingdoms and far, far worse.
To be an ant in such times is to be one amongst countless billions. It is to live in the least humane and most demanding regime possible. There is no peace amongst the canopy, only an eternity of expansion and slaughter, and the laughter of bored entomologists.

Some fun facts about ants mentioning Oecophylla:

Ants forage in a manner known as central place foraging. It is characterized by all prey that is captured or found being carried back to the nest for consumption, either in part or in full. The alternative of moving brood to the food site is logistically unfeasible due to widespread resource dispersal which would require brood to spread out in order to feed. However, some species which live within polydomous nests, as well as Oecophylla longinoda, have managed to solve this problem by virtue of their polydomy. In most species, however, widespread brood dispersal for feeding would require more guards that are, as well, widespread from the colony in order to protect all feeding brood equally. To add to this, when left outside, brood are prone to death either by environmental factors or predation.

The mandibular glands used to secrete these pheromones are likely the mos primitive site of pheromone production in ants, though it's still usual in Ponerinae and some Myrmecinae. However, Crematogaster inflata is an exception as it produces such from enlarged metapleural glands which are located at the backend of the mesosoma, analogous to a human chest. Dolichoderinae, Nothomyrmecia, and Aneuictus simoni produce it using their anal glands. Formicine ants, though, use their mandibular glands which produce a substance that then gets secretions of venom and a set of secretions from the Dufour's gland added to it. The release of this pheromone is met with special postures and behavior wherein the worker bends its gaster forward between its legs and sprays the product of both glands. Oecophylla, Crematogaster, and some other Myrmecinae as well as all Dolichoderinae lift their gaster up over their thorax and the secretion acts as both a pheromone and a predatory repellent.

Many pheromones expressed by ants are a mix of several substances with variation in the mix possibly being a way to differentiate between signals, between or within the same species, to produce variations in response. Within Oecophylla there is also a blend in pheromone components beween populations as well as members of the same population. The secretions of certain components is affected by age, with different components having different effects. This could be related to the fact that ants engage in centrifugal temporal polyethism wherein their role changes based on age.

Not much is currently known about the rates of extinction among ants, especially regarding how they vary in space. However, it is known that Myrmeciinae, Oecophylla, and several other genera have gone extinct from the northern hemisphere which is in line with colder climates having higher rates of extinction. The reason for this may be due to the temperature lowering gradually to uninhabitable temperatures rather than simply "colder temperatures" so to speak.

This one was interesting. I'm enjoying this series. If there are more parts I'm looking forward to them. After I watched it I showed it to my father too and boy do we sympathise with those pest animals. We used to live in Rockhampton, QLD, Australia and we had a nest of them in the big tree in the back yard, though we just called them green ants. They were vicious, we couldn't get close, they hurt like hell. I remember Dad was disappointed because he'd wanted to make us a swing with the tree but it was rare we could get close without getting hurt.

When they most active we couldn't even go to that part of the yard, but that was a small time frame so it was easy to work around. We considered getting rid of them but Dad likes nature and decided the swing wasn't worth it. So long as we respected them and didn't get close when it was more dangerous it was fine. I remember there were rumours their abdomens tasted sweet like honey but we never tried it.

"Talented architects that create castles and city states".

Ummmmm actually, Kurzgesagt is wrong about this. Humans are the only creatures to have created castles, due to our superior intellect and opposable thumbs, allowing us to grip tools required for making castles. Castles have only ever been found within human civilisations from the latest of human history. Ants on the other hand could not create a large building, typically of the medieval period, fortified against attack with thick walls, battlements, towers, and in many cases a moat, due to them having such an inferior intellect to humans as well as not having enough strength to carry the tools and materials required to create a castle, and don't even get me started on the use that a castle would have for an ant (very minimal).

I would like to see Kuzgesagt remove this statement from the video as it is misleading. I would also like a formal apology in the form of an email or a video directed towards me and the millions of people who have been fooled by your lies about ants creating castles. Thank you.

If you were looking for a cool comment, you came to the wrong place
If you were looking for a recipe on how to bake a delicious pie, you came to the right place

*freezable
servings:4
Nutrition: per serving
Nutrient Unit
k cal fat saturates carbs sugars fiber protein salt
673 41g 20g 40g 6g 5g 34g 1.4g
Prep:10 mins
Cook:40 mins


Ingredients
1 tbsp olive oil
1 large onion, finely chopped
3 thyme sprigs, leaves picked
2 garlic cloves, crushed
350g chicken breasts, cut into small chunks
250g chestnut mushrooms, sliced
300ml chicken stock
100g crème fraîche
1 tbsp wholegrain mustard
100g kale
2 tsp cornflour, mixed with 1 tbsp cold water
375g pack puff pastry, rolled into a circle slightly bigger than your dish
1 egg yolk, to glaze

Method
STEP 1
Heat 1/2 tbsp oil over a gentle heat in a flameproof casserole dish. Add the onion and cook for 5 mins until softening. Scatter over the thyme and garlic, and stir for 1 min. Turn up the heat and add the chicken, frying until golden but not fully cooked. Add the mushrooms and the remaining oil. Heat oven to 200C/180 fan/gas 6.

STEP 2
Add the stock, crème fraîche, mustard and kale, and season well. Add the cornflour mixture and stir until thickened a little.

STEP 3
Remove from the heat and cover with the puff pastry lid, pressing into the sides of the casserole dish. Slice a cross in the centre and glaze with the egg. Bake for 30 mins until the pastry is puffed up and golden.

STEP 4

Ant Facts for Kids

There are more than 12,000 species of ants all over the world.

An ant can lift 20 times its own body weight. If a second grader was as strong as an ant, she would be able to pick up a car!

Some queen ants can live for many years and have millions of babies!

Ants don’t have ears. Ants "hear" by feeling vibrations in the ground through their feet.

When ants fight, it is usually to the death!

When foraging, ants leave a pheromone trail so that they know where they’ve been.

Queen ants have wings, which they shed when they start a new nest.

Ants don’t have lungs. Oxygen enters through tiny holes all over the body and carbon dioxide leaves through the same holes.

When the queen of the colony dies, the colony can only survive a few months. Queens are rarely replaced and the workers are not able to reproduce.
